intro: Bellevalia flexuosa var. flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and slightly zigzagged, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
